definition: to win (favors, confidence etc)
old variant of 博[bo2]
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch

sentences.english: One of the most common tricks pickpockets use is to wear a uniform to gain trust.
sentences.chinese: 骗子们常用的一个骗术之一是身穿制服博取信任。

sentences.english: Avoid shy. To win the juvenile memories.
sentences.chinese: 怕丑的回避，却为博取那少年的回忆。

sentences.english: Seeks the advantages of long in basis we'll pay more attention to study hard and details.
sentences.chinese: 在博取众家之长的基础上，我们将更注重用功与细节。

sentences.english: Mitzy tried to milk the audience for applause.
sentences.chinese: 米茨极力想博取观众的掌声。

sentences.english: To gain the trust of the wu beauty like ice, a knife to kill wu beauty.
sentences.chinese: 喜冰博取了吴美人的信任，一刀杀了吴美人。

definition: to win/to gain
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat
to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
to try to please
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
committing all manner of crimes/completely unscrupulous
pinyin: wu2 suo3 bu4 yong4 qi2 ji2

definition: to cater to/to pander to
to plunder/to loot/robbery/pillage
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
